page.title: 04The Rookery
page.content:
The{Rookery}was{built in 1727}as a vicarage and the vicar lived there with his{fourteen servants.}He moved out some time later because the house was too small for him.
In later years{another vicarage}was built which is now called{Wellington {House.}The new wing added to The Rookery was built on in 1879 which was in the time of{Sir Jonathan Backhouse} who lived there and was a{founder}of {Barclay's Bank. Edward Backhouse} lived in The Rookery after his brother; he {was a scholar} who translated Chinese}books into the English language.
The Rookery has changed quite a lot over the years and{now}there is only {one part-time help}and she works ten hours per week.
